Attention; 
This email is coming to you on the instruction of the International Finance Corporation (IFC) Headquarters here in New York. Please read attentively, my name is Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald, a former director of finance at the International Monetary Fund (IMF) between June 2010 to Sept 2019 and presently working as a private consultant on fiscal and monetary policies to the International Finance Corporation (IFC) at its headquarters in New York, where I am handling  the verification of a fund disbursement project.
My firm  FITZ & COPPERLAND INC as a private consultant to the International Finance Corporation (IFC), we were given specific assignments and responsibility to review and re-open past and present financial transactions that were either abandoned, inconclusive or mishandled by some unauthorized persons. We shall carefully scrutinize all payment files,identify genuine beneficiaries and make necessary recommendations to the IFC Headquarters for approval of payment and subsequent disbursement of approved funds to the beneficiary
We are therefore contacting you because from the records available to us  you are listed as one of the fund beneficiaries with $15.2 million dollars unpaid funds which were previously mishandled by some impersonators who had tried to take advantage of you . Please kindly confirm your legitimacy as a beneficiary and your readiness to work with us in resolving the issues around your payment by responding immediately to this message.
Sincerely,
Suzzieane Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

Dear Jane Smith,
Thank you for the questions, well it is instructive to note that I am a
private consultant to the International Finance Corporation (IFC) who are
the lead facilitators of this fund payment exercise and my firm was
contracted to scrutinize and verify details of the 3 lucky beneficiaries of
which you are one of them and to be sure the beneficiaries are genuine and
deserving of the fund.
It will also interest you to know that I have an enviable track record of
integrity which I built in over 23 years of my career as financial analyst
with the IMF,diplomat and investment banker. I can never get involved in
any question transaction that will tarnish my hard earned reputation. So if
this fund payment project is questioned I would have withdrawn from my
contract with the IFC. So I urge you to trust the process.  We shall give
your further detail and the procedures to claim your funds if you are
willing to work with us and to follow up with the process.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)
Thank you.

Dear Jane Smith,
Here is a scan copy of the letter of fund ownership and privileges issued
by the U.S Department of the Treasury to one of the 3 beneficiaries.  This
particular document belongs to Mr. Martin Aguilar Tinajero, a  Mexican
whose funds  has been approved and finally disbursed to him recently. It is
a highly classified document but I decided to send this to you in
confidence so you can have an idea of what the $985 fee is all about and
the reason you are required to pay the fee.
Please acknowledge receipt of this email and the attached letter and let us
know your position, so that we can proceed with the process.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)
From: f**************e@gmail.com
To: zx64077@m**************m
Time: 2023-03-16 13:43:41
SUBJECT: Re: REGARDING YOUR UNPAID FUND
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
Once again thank you for your question, it is appropriate to ask necessary
question(s) in order for you to make an informed decision. Yes, there is a
fee of $985 to be paid in the course of processing the payment of the
funds, and it is an administrative levy charged by the U.S Financial
Intelligence Office for the issuance of a Fund Ownership certificate in
your name and this certificate is expected to be obtained by the fund
beneficiary and presented to the designated bank before the bank will begin
the disbursement of the funds to the beneficiary's receiving account
account.
However, it is very instructive to note that this $985 fee is the only
money you are expected to pay in the course of the transaction. There will
be no other charges or fees to be paid by the beneficiary either directly
or indirectly until the funds are successfully disbursed to your account by
the designated bank and confirmed by you. Just for your information, JP
Morgan Chase is the officially designated bank appointed by the
International Finance Corporation (IFC) to disburse approved funds to
deservining beneficiaries.
The fund approval and disbursement exercise is an open and transparent
process. I am going to send you a scan copy of the letter of confirmation
of fund ownership as issued by the United States Department of the Treasury
to one of the 3 beneficiaries, a Mexican national whose funds were finally
released to him recently. I am sending you a scan copy of the letter in
confidence so you can see and have an idea of what you are required to pay
for in order to make up your mind. We await your position on this as
quickly as possible so we can move forward with the rest of the process.
I attached a scan copy of my ID for purposes of identification.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

Dear Jane Smith,
I'm sorry for the late reply. I have been very busy and had little time to
attend to email. Well, I'm going to answer these questions as elaborately
as I can and I hope I won't have to answer these questions all over again.
Now, a total of 23 participants from different countries were randomly
selected  for this exercise and out of the 23 participants, 3 lucky people
finally emerged winners of the grand prizes of 15.2m each through an open
raffle draw that was held at the head office of the International Finance
Corporation (IFC) in New York. The lucky winners/participants are John
Cunningham from Montreal Canada, Jane Smith from the United Kingdom and
Martin Aguilar Tinagero from Mexico.
This is the first and only edition  of this fund payment project, and it
was done in commemoration of the 40th anniversary of the International
Finance  Corporation (IFC), and so there has never been any previous
winners as it is just a one off  event and not a yearly event. The issue of
 your chances of winning does not  arise in the first instance, because by
virtue of being amongst the 3 lucky participants selected in the raffle
draw, you are already a winner, and you are entitled the prize. The prize
shall be disbursed to you and the others through the designated bank JP
Morgan Chase, after official approval has been  given by the board of
directors of the IFC.
It is also instructive to note that the $15,250,000.00 prize  would be paid
to you in tranches (3 installments). The first installment will be $8
million U.S dollar, the second installment $4 million USD, while the last
and final Will be $3.2 USD ($3,250,000). The disbursements are to be made
either by a certified bank draft or direct wire transfer to your receiving
account, so you are expected to choose your preferred mode of payment. One
of the 3 lucky participants Mr Martin Aguilar from Mexico has received his
first  installment of a certified bank draft of $8 million U.S dollars, he
 confirmed receipt of his payment on Monday last week.  I hope this answers
your questions.
Sincerely,
Sussie Fitzgerald
Principal Partner: FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.

conversations.subject: SUBJECT:   FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Attention; 
This email is coming to you on the instruction of the International Finance Corporation (IFC) Headquarters here in New York. Please read attentively, my name is Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald, a former director of finance at the International Monetary Fund (IMF) between June 2010 to Sept 2019 and presently working as a private consultant on fiscal and monetary policies to the International Finance Corporation (IFC) at its headquarters in New York, where I am handling  the verification of a fund disbursement project.
My firm  FITZ & COPPERLAND INC as a private consultant to the International Finance Corporation (IFC), we were given specific assignments and responsibility to review and re-open past and present financial transactions that were either abandoned, inconclusive or mishandled by some unauthorized persons. We shall carefully scrutinize all payment files,identify genuine beneficiaries and make necessary recommendations to the IFC Headquarters for approval of payment and subsequent disbursement of approved funds to the beneficiary
We are therefore contacting you because from the records available to us  you are listed as one of the fund beneficiaries with $15.2 million dollars unpaid funds which were previously mishandled by some impersonators who had tried to take advantage of you . Please kindly confirm your legitimacy as a beneficiary and your readiness to work with us in resolving the issues around your payment by responding immediately to this message.
Sincerely,
Suzzieane Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re:   FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
conversations.body:
Dear Suzzieane, 
Wow, that is a lot of money to win! Can I ask you some questions about the claiming prorcess?
 Kind Regards,
Jane Smith
___________________________________
Jane Smith,
Senior Financial Manager,
vodafone.co.uk/business
1 Kingdom St, London,
Greater London

845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022

We are in receipt of your reply to our earlier message regarding proposed
payment of the $15.2million funds.
Please feel free to ask any question and we will get back to you.
Sincerely,
Suzzieane Jenkins Fitzgerald

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: REGARDING YOUR UNPAID FUND
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
Thank you for the questions, well it is instructive to note that I am a
private consultant to the International Finance Corporation (IFC) who are
the lead facilitators of this fund payment exercise and my firm was
contracted to scrutinize and verify details of the 3 lucky beneficiaries of
which you are one of them and to be sure the beneficiaries are genuine and
deserving of the fund.
It will also interest you to know that I have an enviable track record of
integrity which I built in over 23 years of my career as financial analyst
with the IMF,diplomat and investment banker. I can never get involved in
any question transaction that will tarnish my hard earned reputation. So if
this fund payment project is questioned I would have withdrawn from my
contract with the IFC. So I urge you to trust the process.  We shall give
your further detail and the procedures to claim your funds if you are
willing to work with us and to follow up with the process.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)
Thank you.

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: LETTER OF FUND OWNERSHIP
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
Here is a scan copy of the letter of fund ownership and privileges issued
by the U.S Department of the Treasury to one of the 3 beneficiaries.  This
particular document belongs to Mr. Martin Aguilar Tinajero, a  Mexican
whose funds  has been approved and finally disbursed to him recently. It is
a highly classified document but I decided to send this to you in
confidence so you can have an idea of what the $985 fee is all about and
the reason you are required to pay the fee.
Please acknowledge receipt of this email and the attached letter and let us
know your position, so that we can proceed with the process.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: REGARDING YOUR UNPAID FUND
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
Once again thank you for your question, it is appropriate to ask necessary
question(s) in order for you to make an informed decision. Yes, there is a
fee of $985 to be paid in the course of processing the payment of the
funds, and it is an administrative levy charged by the U.S Financial
Intelligence Office for the issuance of a Fund Ownership certificate in
your name and this certificate is expected to be obtained by the fund
beneficiary and presented to the designated bank before the bank will begin
the disbursement of the funds to the beneficiary's receiving account
account.
However, it is very instructive to note that this $985 fee is the only
money you are expected to pay in the course of the transaction. There will
be no other charges or fees to be paid by the beneficiary either directly
or indirectly until the funds are successfully disbursed to your account by
the designated bank and confirmed by you. Just for your information, JP
Morgan Chase is the officially designated bank appointed by the
International Finance Corporation (IFC) to disburse approved funds to
deservining beneficiaries.
The fund approval and disbursement exercise is an open and transparent
process. I am going to send you a scan copy of the letter of confirmation
of fund ownership as issued by the United States Department of the Treasury
to one of the 3 beneficiaries, a Mexican national whose funds were finally
released to him recently. I am sending you a scan copy of the letter in
confidence so you can see and have an idea of what you are required to pay
for in order to make up your mind. We await your position on this as
quickly as possible so we can move forward with the rest of the process.
I attached a scan copy of my ID for purposes of identification.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: LETTER OF FUND OWNERSHIP
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane,
I thought I had answered this question initially, there were 12
participants out of which 3 were finally selected through a raffle draw
held at the headquarters of the International Finance Corporation in New
York, and you are fortunate to be one of the lucky 3. Now out of these 3
lucky participants one has finally received his funds which is the Mexican
Mr Martin Aguilar whom I sent you his letter of fund ownership.
And regarding the time frame allowed by the authorities for the beneficiary
to pay the fee for the document, it is a maximum of 7 working days , from
the day the official approval is given for the disbursement of the funds.
So, the process requires that you will provide your details and a valid ID,
and then an e-file will be opened in your name and your name and we will
send a recommendation to the Headquarters of the International Finance
Corporation  (IFC) for approval of your payment by board of directors,
thereafter the designated bank JP Morgan Chase will begin the process of
disbursement of the funds to your account.
These are the procedures, it is simple, open and transparent.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: FOR YOUR INFORMATION
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Hello Jane Smith,
Once again the deadline for paying the $985 administrative fee for the
issuance of the fund ownership document is 7 working days,and it can be
extended if there is any need, but the beneficiary will have to officially
inform the authorities and apply for extension of time to raise the amount
for the fee.
I hope this answers your question.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: LETTER OF FUND OWNERSHIP
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
I have patiently and comprehensively answered all your questions just to
clear whatever doubt you may have about the legitimacy of this transaction.
Like I stated earlier I have built an enviable track record of integrity
which I garnered in over 23yrs of my career as a senior financial analyst
with the IMF, and as a diplomat and Investment banker. I want to maintain
again that if this fund payment project by the IFC were questionable I
would have pulled out of my contract with the IFC long before now, because
I can not afford to get involved in any dealings that will rubbish my image
and throw my records to the trash bi
I can understand your cautious position and curiosity because you would not
want to make any mistake, and I want to assure you that you are not making
any mistake. This transaction is 100% legitimate and the process is open
and transparent. Just as i informed you earlier that out of the 3 lucky
participants only 1 beneficiary has finally received his funds and that is
the Mexican Mr Martin Aguilar Tinajero, but I can not give you any  deeper
details about the him because it is strictly is private information, and I
will be going against the code of conduct and my contract guidelines by
releasing his payment details to you. I can only advise you to trust the
process and follow the procedures and definitely you will have the funds
disbursed to you without any hitch.
Thank you.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: FOR YOUR INFORMATION
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
Yes I am 100% sure you are definitely the right person *Jane Smith *selected
from the available slot allocated to the United Kingdom and your email
 *(zx64077@mail.gel2mail.com
<zx64077@mail.gel2mail.com>)* drew the lucky raffle amongst many other
participants from the U.K. Let emphasize once again for the avoidance of
doubt that this fund payment arrangement is financed by the International
Finance Corporation (IFC) as the lead facilitator in collaboration with the
IMF and World Bank humanitarian office. And our responsibility as the lead
consultant is to identify genuine beneficiaries who are legitimately
entitled to the funds, verify their payment details and then make
recommendations to the IFC head office for payment approval. All approved
funds are to be disbursed through the designated bank, JP Morgan Chase via
a direct bank-to-bank wire transfer to the beneficiary's nominated bank
account.
I think I have explained enough about this fund payment project, I have
meticulously answered all your questions and I have done enough to clear
whatever doubt or fears that you may have about the legitimacy of this
payment exercise and the sincerity of the disbursement process, it is left
for you to make up your mind so that we can proceed with the process and
you have limited time to decide otherwise your transaction maybe terminated
and another raffle will be conducted to fill the void.
Thank you.
Sincerely,
Suzzie Jenkins Fitzgerald
Principal Partner (FITZ & COPPERLAND INC)

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: FOR YOUR INFORMATION
conversations.body:
Dear Jane Smith,
I have answered virtually all questions in my previous email, yet you seem
to be repeating the same questions over and again. I am not going to take
any more questions, I think I have answered the critical question and
provided enough insight on the criteria and procedures for the disbursement
of the fund. I have also tried to dispel whatever fears or doubt that you
may have about the legitimacy of the transaction and the release of the
fund to you, and at this point it is left for you to make up you mind
whether to go ahead with the process by providing your details so we can
open a file for you or on the other hand you may decide to withdraw your
interest from the fund claim. The choice is yours to make.
However, if you decide on the latter, which is to withdraw your interest
from the fund claims, please do kindly let us know by sending an email,  so
that we can officially inform the authorities at the International Finance
Corporation (IFC) about your decision to withdraw from the process, so that
a fresh raffle draw can be organized to fill your place.
Thank you.
Suzzie J. Fitzgerald

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: LETTER OF FUND OWNERSHIP
conversations.body:
Dear Jane,
I would not know how the fee is calculated  whether on a percentage basis
or flat rate, and I am not in the position to explain anything concerning
the fees. The issue of fees and levies are the exclusive preserve of the
U.S Department of the Treasury, that is the office that issues the Fund
Ownership document and they are the ones that decides the charges or fees
to be paid on the issuance of the document.
Thank you.
Suzzie J. Fitzgerald
Principal Partner: FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: FOR YOUR INFORMATION
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
I have patiently accommodated so many questions from you, as much as I
appreciate that it is appropriate to ask questions especially in a
transaction as huge as this, I think that you have asked the relevant
questions which I have provided satisfactory answers. However, I  am a very
busy person and I can not spend all my time answering questions from you, I
have other pressing official issues I need to attend to. You are the only
beneficiary , the other beneficiary from Montreal Canada has already
provided his details and we are already processing his payment after the
beneficiary from Mexico Mr Martins Aguilar had already received his payment
and he confirmed the amount in his account  Monday this week.
Meanwhile, I will be magnanimous enough to take just one more question from
you, and after this no more questions will be entertained. I hope you ask
the right and relevant questions now. So, if you are satisfied then you may
provide your detail, (Full names, address, date of birth, nationality,
phone number and a valid ID) as soon as we receive these info we shall
immediately open an e-file for you  and process your payment and  your data
will be entered into the central database, and then a recommendation will
be sent to the IFC headquarters for approval of your payment by the board
of directors. The designated bank JP Morgan Chase bank will immediately
begin the process of disbursement of the approved amount to your receiving
account and this will take a maximum of 5 working days.
Thank you.
Sussie Fitzgerald
Principal Partner: FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: REGARDING YOUR FUNDS
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
I'm sorry for the late reply. I have been very busy and had little time to
attend to email. Well, I'm going to answer these questions as elaborately
as I can and I hope I won't have to answer these questions all over again.
Now, a total of 23 participants from different countries were randomly
selected  for this exercise and out of the 23 participants, 3 lucky people
finally emerged winners of the grand prizes of 15.2m each through an open
raffle draw that was held at the head office of the International Finance
Corporation (IFC) in New York. The lucky winners/participants are John
Cunningham from Montreal Canada, Jane Smith from the United Kingdom and
Martin Aguilar Tinagero from Mexico.
This is the first and only edition  of this fund payment project, and it
was done in commemoration of the 40th anniversary of the International
Finance  Corporation (IFC), and so there has never been any previous
winners as it is just a one off  event and not a yearly event. The issue of
 your chances of winning does not  arise in the first instance, because by
virtue of being amongst the 3 lucky participants selected in the raffle
draw, you are already a winner, and you are entitled the prize. The prize
shall be disbursed to you and the others through the designated bank JP
Morgan Chase, after official approval has been  given by the board of
directors of the IFC.
It is also instructive to note that the $15,250,000.00 prize  would be paid
to you in tranches (3 installments). The first installment will be $8
million U.S dollar, the second installment $4 million USD, while the last
and final Will be $3.2 USD ($3,250,000). The disbursements are to be made
either by a certified bank draft or direct wire transfer to your receiving
account, so you are expected to choose your preferred mode of payment. One
of the 3 lucky participants Mr Martin Aguilar from Mexico has received his
first  installment of a certified bank draft of $8 million U.S dollars, he
 confirmed receipt of his payment on Monday last week.  I hope this answers
your questions.
Sincerely,
Sussie Fitzgerald
Principal Partner: FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.

conversations.subject: SUBJECT: Re: Attention: Jane Smith
conversations.body:
FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
845 3rd Ave 8th Floor
New York, NY 10022
United States
Dear Jane Smith,
We appreciate the fact that you are trying to be careful and cautious
before making your decision, I have personally given you my word that this
is a legitimate project carried out by the International Finance
Corporation (IFC) in celebration of their 40th anniversary, it is the
inaugural edition and therefore there are no previous winners.  Just as I
explained in my previous emails, there are only 3 lucky winners in this
inaugural edition which includes you, and one of the winners Mr. Martin
Aguilar Tinajero from Mexico has already received his first payment of
$8million U.S dollars in certified bank draft. The other winner Mr. John
Cunningham from Canada, is still processing his payment and it is about 85%
completed, he prefers a direct bank transfer to his account at HSBC. This
is the situation regarding the disbursement of the $15.2million to
winners/beneficiaries.
However, the management of the International Finance Corporation will be
willing to give you a letter of guarantee, should you need any further
assurance about the legitimacy of this fund disbursement exercise. But I
wish to assure you once again that this is undoubtedly legitimate, the
process is open and transparent and you will surely receive your
prize/winning without a hitch whatsoever, if only you will follow the
simple procedures for claiming your winning.
Sincerely,
Sussie Fitzgerald
Principal Partner: FITZ & COPPERLAND INC.
